attributes.comment:
Please do not increase adoption fees.

The current fees are already burdensome and ridiculously high given lengthy
processing times, poor customer service, and the fact that most parents like us
who are adopting from China will have to pay USCIS adoption fees TWICE since we
will have to renew our I-600A during the wait to travel to pick up our precious
children from their birth country.

Plus, the USCIS has already raised I-600A fees all too frequently, most recently:

2005, from $525 to $545
2004, from $460 to $525
2002, from $405 to $460
1998, from $155 to $405

To hardworking middle-class Americans such as my husband and I, the proposed
I-600 fee increase of almost 23% comes across as predatory and money-grubbing.
If the USCIS needs to cut costs, it should improve efficiency rather than
increasing adoption fees.

Please say no to increased adoption fees.

Thank you very much.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Cheryl L. Carpenter
